Key Arguments: Concerns about who will decide what constitutes misinformation or disinformation, as it may be subjective and based on personal opinions.
Government departments are excluded from the legislation, which is seen as unfair and undemocratic.
Belief in personal responsibility for discerning truth and the importance of free speech in a democracy.
Concerns about conflicts of interest within government and corporations affecting decision-making.
The legislation is viewed as a threat to freedom of speech and creativity.
Notable Quotes: The Govt has no right to tell us as the people what is right and what is wrong. That is for us to decide.
To stifle this freedom of speech is to stifle creation.
I do not at all support this new bill. It should not come into effect and it should be abolished as it will stop freedom of speech.
